fZSbi8SD.title: Effects of interfacial interaction on chain dynamics of rubber/graphene oxide hybrids: A dielectric relaxation spectroscopy study
fZSbi8SD.abstract: Hybrids consisting of graphene oxide (GO) sheets and butadiene-styrene- vinyl pyridine rubber (VPR) were prepared by a co-coagulation process with different flocculants, hydrogen chloride and calcium chloride, in order to form two kinds of bonding interfaces, namely ionic bonding (HVPR) and hydrogen bonding (CaVPR) interfaces. To reveal the effects of interfacial interaction on the chain dynamics, the dielectric relaxation spectra of these hybrids have been investigated. The results show that all hybrids exhibit two distinct relaxation processes, segmental relaxation and interfacial relaxation. The concentration of GO has no impact on the segmental dynamics of CaVPR, but the segmental dynamics of HVPR slow down at 1.5 vol% of GO. Meanwhile, the segmental relaxation of HVPR is always a little faster than its CaVPR counterpart. In the temperature range of 5-35°C, a new relaxation mode, which is slower than the segmental relaxation and attributed to the interphase with restricted chain dynamics, has been observed for all the hybrids with a GO loading lower than 2.5 vol%. The interfacial relaxation time of HVPR decreases with decreasing GO concentration. However, in CaVPR it first decreases and then increases with decreasing GO concentration. Most interestingly, the interfacial relaxation of HVPR is slower than that for CaVPR. The dielectric strength (Δε), the calculated fragility parameter and the effective activation enthalpy of the interfacial chains in HVPR are always higher than those in CaVPR with the same GO concentration. All the evidence indicates the stronger interfacial interactions in HVPR than in CaVPR. This journal is © The Royal Society of Chemistry 2013.

xHWew8Po.title: Effect of Amino—Silane KH—792 on the Structure and Properties of Starch/SBR Composites
xHWew8Po.abstract: The amino-silane KH—792 was used to prepare starch/SBR composites by two ways,dry mixing(method Ⅰ)and wet mixing(methodⅡ).The effect of the loading of KH—792 on the curing characters,mechanical properties and morphology of the composites prepared by the two methods was studied.The results showed that the reactions of KH—792 were different in the two kinds of composites,especially embodied in the curing characters,however the mechanical properties of the composites were improved to a certain extend;the stress of the composites prepared by method I was higher,while the tensile strength and the tear strength of the composites were higher when the method Ⅱwas introduced.SEM showed that the composites prepared by methodⅡhad more fine disperse phase and higher interfacial strength.

5h1L7DUo.title: Influence factors and devulcanization effect of reclaiming vulcanized natural rubber in supercritical carbon dioxide
5h1L7DUo.abstract: The vulcanized natural rubber (NR) was devulcanized in supercritical CO2 fluid by using diphenyl disulfide (DD) as a devulcanizing reagent.The effects of CO2 density,temperature,pressure and reaction time on the devulcanization were discussed.The degradation products from the devulcanization were characterized by gel permeation chromatography and nuclear magnetic resonance.The results showed that the vulcanized NR was devulcanized when supercritical CO2 used as solvent under the conditions in which the density of the supercritical CO2 fluid was over 0.472 2 g/cm3,the temperature was above 160 ℃,and the reaction time should be lasted to more than 90 min.The sol ratio increased with the increase of reaction temperature and time.In devulcanization,besides S—S and S—C,a part of main chain was cloven,leading to the relative molecular mass of the reclaiming rubber decreased.The devulcanizing reagent DD could open crosslinked bond effectively,and there was a little benzene ring structure introduced in the reclaiming rubber.

GF8YWNr8.title: Application of aramid pulp fibres in NR/BR tire tread
GF8YWNr8.abstract: The reinforcement of a new type of aramid pulp superfine short fibres to NR/BR tire tread was investigated. The results showed that the NR/BR vulcanizate reinforced by aramid pulp superfine short fibres had good modulus-hysteresis balance; by using 3 phr aramid pulp fibre, tensile modulus at 20% elongation of the vulcanizate increased by about 2 times, tanδ at 0 ℃ increased,and tanδ at 60 ℃ decreased slightly, and at the same time the processibility of the compound changed little. The NR/BR blend reinforced by aramid pulp superfine short fibres could be used in the tire tread.

oiSB6oN8.title: Prediction on the young's modulus of short fiber rubber composites
oiSB6oN8.abstract: The longitudinal and transverse young's modulus short nylon fiber/natural rubber and neoprene composites were predicted. Based on Halpin-Tsai equation, the average length and orientation factor fp were introduced into it to consider the effect of short fiber length distribution and orientation on the longitudinal young's modulus of composites. A new way which expressed the effect of orientation on the longitudinal young's modulus by means of fp modifying ξθ was put forward: ξθ =Ld-1 (fp+1). The results show that the predicted values of longitudinal young's modulus fit the experimental data well. To the prediction of transverse young's modulus of composites, the effect of orientation of short fiber on modulus was considered through ξ=2+Kvf where K was constant which varied depending on different composites. The result shows that there is a successful prediction on transverse young's modulus of these two kinds of composites.

etPoo8Ss.title: Morphology and properties of ultra-fine full-vulcanized styrene butadienerubber powder/ethylene propylene diene monomer blends
etPoo8Ss.abstract: A novel ultra-fine full-vulcanized styrene butadiene rubber powder(UFPSBR)/ethylene propylene diene monomer(EPDM) blends were prepared.The morphology,dynamic property,curing property and mechanical properties of the blends were discussed in details.TEM observations showed that no matter how the mass ratio of UFPSBR to(EPDM) matrix was,UFPSBR particles always kept dispersion phase.When the mass ratio of UFPSBR/EPDM was 10/90,UFPSBR were finely and uniformly dispersed in EPDM as spherical particles with the size close to its original particle size,about 200 nm.However,as the mass ratio of UFPSBR to EPDM increased,the UFPSBR particles started to agglomerate.Correspondingly,the size of dispersion phase became larger and larger,and the shape of dispersion phase evolved into strip from particle.Dynamic property illustrated by(DMTA) demonstrated that two phases exhibited two separate glass transition temperatures,The results by rubber processing Analyzer showed that(UFPSBR) particles in(EPDM) matrix formed a network.At the same time,the introduction of(UFPSBR) particles evidently affected the vulcanization of(EPDM) when sulfur was used as vulcanizing agent,but these elastomeric fillers exhibit the prominent reinforcement effect to(rubber) matrix when peroxide was used as vulcanizing agent.
keywords: ultra-fine full-vulcanized styrene butadiene rubber powder

RGju2T16.title: Grafting glutamic acid to a polyethylene terephthalate (PET) film treated with NH_3 plasma
RGju2T16.abstract: Polyethylene terephthalate(PET) surfaces have been treated with NH3 plasma,and subsequently grafted with glutamic acid using glutaraldehyde as crosslinker.The extent of surface modification of the PET films was investigated by contact angle measurements,ATR-FTIR,XPS spectra and activated partial thromboplastin time(APTT) measurements.The properties of the films after treatment with NH3 alone were compared with those obtained after subsequent grafting with glutamic acid.It was found that the former are superior to the latter,and the blood compatibility was best when the power used was 70 W.The APTT times of the NH3-treated film and the grafted film were respectively 5.9 s and 3.2 s longer than that of the untreated film.

q0boI8HQ.title: Preparation and properties of carbonyl iron/strontium ferrite/MVQ wave-absorbing composites
q0boI8HQ.abstract: A carbonyl iron/strontium ferrite/MVQ wave-absorbing composite was prepared,and the effect of the blending ratio of carbonyl iron/strontium ferrite on the properties of the composites was investigated.The results showed that,as the addition level of carbonyl iron decreased while total filler volume fraction was constant,the absorption peaks of carbonyl iron/strontium ferrite/MVQ composites were between the peaks of carbonyl iron/MVQ and strontium ferrite/MVQ composite;the frequency band of the composites in the range of lower than-10 dB was increased at first and then decreased;the absorption peaks moved to higher frequency position;the tensile strength and the elongation at break were changed a little,the compression set was decreased and the dynamic properties were improved.

ZJoVwhjy.title: Study on piezoelectric and acoustic properties of piezoelectric ceramics/NBR composite
ZJoVwhjy.abstract: A piezoelectric ceramics/NBR composite was prepared,and its piezoelectric and acoustic properties were investigated.The results showed that,the piezoelectric constant(d33) of the composite increased with the increase of piezoelectric ceramics content.The d33 was up to 3.1×10-11 C·N-1 when the addition level of piezoelectric ceramics was 5 210 phr.The d33 of the composite increased with polarizing time,and increased at the beginning and then decreased with the increase of polarizing temperature.The optimal polarizing time was 25 min and the optimal temperature was 80 ℃.The study on the acoustic property indicated that acoustic absorption coefficient of the composite increased as the piezoelectric constant increasing at the frequency range of 2~3 kHz.Moreover,addition of the carbon fiber(CF) could enhance the acoustic absorption coefficient due to the formation of a conductive network of CF.

gEOL538e.title: Dispersing graphene in hydroxypropyl cellulose by utilizing its lcst behavior
gEOL538e.abstract: A novel method for producing graphene/hydroxypropyl cellulose (HPC) composite with a fine dispersion of graphene is established. The thermoresponsive HPC, with low a critical solution temperature (LCST) behavior, becomes self-associated into nanospheres when its homogeneous solution is heated to a temperature higher than the LCST. The formed nanospheres of HPC can then "clamp" graphene layers and get them finely dispersed in solution and in the polymer matrix. Incorporating graphene via this method can largely prevent graphene from agglomeration. Compared with the conventional casting method, the proposed LCST method can further enhance the electrical conductivity of HPC/graphene composites by 2-3 orders of magnitude. The percolation threshold value of RGO loading is as low as 0.11 vol%. Graphene layers are "sandwiched" into the nanospheres of hydroxypropyl cellulose (HPC) during its conformational transition. Via this method, the dispersion of graphene is manipulated well and the electrical conductivity of the HPC/graphene composites is enhanced further by 2-3 orders of magnitude, compared with the casting method. HshloWPT.title: Structure and properties of isobutylene-isoprene rubber/polypropylene (IIR/PP) thermoplastic vulcanizates. II. Factors affecting elasticity of IIR/PP TPV
HshloWPT.abstract: The factors affecting the elasticity of butyl rubber/polypropylene thermoplastic vulcanizates (TPV) were investigated systemically and the mechanism for the effect of high temperature compression on elasticity was analyzed. The results showed that the elasticity was improved with increasing the crosslinking density of rubber and the crystallinity of polypropylene. Adding 10%-20% (mass fraction) of chlorinated paraffin and dibutyl tin laurate could decrease compression set of TPV evidently. With increasing the ratio of rubber to plastic, the elasticity of TPV also meliorated. It was found that the compress temperature affected the elasticity of TPV markedly. With raising the compress temperature, the compression set increased notably. At high compress temperature, the viscidity of rubber phase increased, the elasticity of TPV decreased. The movement of the molecular chain of polypropylene was enhanced and some molecular chain shifted.

nZkTd66E.title: Structure and performance of high conductibility of silvered glass bead/silicone rubber composites
nZkTd66E.abstract: The effect of superficial modification,particle size and amount of filler on conductibilty,mechanical properties and morphological structure of silvered glass bead(SGB)/methyl vinyl silicone rubber(VMQ) composites was studied,and the factors of electrical conductive network of SGB/VMQ composites were discussed.The results showed that the mechanical properties of composites were improved by adding coupling agents to the composites,the conductibility of composites was also maintained when vinyltriethoxy silane (A-151) was used especially.The conductibility and mechanical properties of SGB/VMQ composites were good when fillers of SGB were 41 μm and 300 phr.The electrical mechanism of electrical conductive rubber was due to the dispersion of the fillers that could form the conductive paths.Above the threshold of filler loading to form conductive paths,the quantity of fillers added was as little as possible to improve the mechanical properties.

8rwzgZk0.title: Preparation, structure and properties of short para aramid fiber/ hydrogenated nitrile-butadiene rubber composites
8rwzgZk0.abstract: Hydrogenated nitrile-butadiene rubber with excellent comprehensive properties was reinforced by-powered para aramid. The composites showed high tensile strength, high modulus and high temperature resistance. Mechanical and rheological properties influenced by kinds and contents of fibers were researched. It was proved that aramid pulp ( PPTA-pulp) had better effect on reinforcing the composites than dipped chopped fibers(DCF). They were both elevating the high temperature strength of composites, but PPTA-pulp was more effective. More over, extrudate of the composites reinforced by PPTA-pulp was more smooth than that of DCF.

Nwpfh9li.title: Effects of Mixing Technology on Properties of Silica Filled Rubber Compound
Nwpfh9li.abstract: The effect of mixing technology on the properties of silica filled SSBR or NR compound was experimentally investigated.The results showed that,the compounds prepared by open mill possessed lower Mooney viscosity,while the vulcanizates prepared by internal mixer had higher modulus and tensile strength,better wet skid resistance and lower heat build-up.

WQ54L6zI.title: Preparation and properties of C_5 petroleum resin/ethylene-propylene-diene monomer composites
WQ54L6zI.abstract: A C5 petroleum resin/ethylene-propylene-diene monomer(EPDM) composite was successfully prepared by mixing petroleum resin into EPDM.The microstructure and properties of C5 petroleum resin/EPDM composites were characterized by differential scanning calorimetry,scanning electron microscope and dynamic mechanical analysis.The results showed that C5 petroleum resin could finely disperse into the EPDM matrix.The aggregates of the petroleum resin molecular was formed,when its level was up to 30 phr in the composites.The glass transition temperature of the composites shifted to high temperature direction with increasing the contents of C5 petroleum resin.It could be attributed to the good compatibility between EPDM and the C5 petroleum resin.Compared with the neat matrix,the loss peak of the composites shifted to the high temperature direction.The damping temperature range(the chemical shift no less than 0.3) and the loss peak area(TA value) increased largely.At the same time,the C5 petroleum resin/EPDM(30/100) composites exhibited the obvious characteristics of tensile orientation,and good mechanical properties.

vGYdqcV2.title: Microstructure and dynamic mechanical properties of hindered phenol AO-80/NBR/PVC crosslinking composites
vGYdqcV2.abstract: The hindered phenol AO-80/nitrile-butadiene rubber (NBR)/poly(vinyl chloride) (PVC) crosslinking composites were prepared and their microstructure and dynamic mechanical properties were investigated. SEM and TEM prove that the majority of AO-80 dissolve in the NBR/PVC matrix and the remnants AO-80 in the submicro-size particles distribute in the matrix. The DSC and XRD results illustrate that AO-80 in the matrix exists in an amorphous form. The results of DSC and DMTA prove that strong intermolecular interactions are formed between AO-80 and NBR/PVC matrix. All the AO-80/NBR/PVC crosslinking composites have only one tanδ peak, which displays the excellent compatibility between the AO-80 and the NBR/PVC matrix. More importantly, the tanδ peaks of the crosslinking composites shift to the higher temperature with increasing of the AO-80 amount in the composites, and the tanδ value of the crosslinking composites obviously synchronously increases. The chemical crosslinking of the composites results in considerable tensile strength. The high damping and mechanical properties endow the composites with a potential and promising application future in engineering.

snMhJ4bu.title: Study of in-situ micro-fibre of DPDM/PA
snMhJ4bu.abstract: To prepare rubber compound with excellent properties, such as tensile strength, tear strength, hot tear strength and striking heat resistance property, a study was made on micro-fiber of EPDM/PA. It was the first time to find this phenomenon that after some parts of carbon black were replaced by ternary-nylon-copolymer (nylon6/66/1010=20/10/70), the mechanical properties of this compound vulcanized by peroxide, especially hot tear could be improved magnificently, while the composite kept its striking heat resistance property. SEM shows that disperse particles can be changed into micro-fibers through some special treatment. Micro-fibers are disorderly oriented in one plane, which is vertical to the direction of vulcanization's tension. Only a few micro-fibers become irregular through vulcanizing. Physical test reveals that elongations at break along the lengthways direction are larger than elongations at break along the vertical direction, which is contradictory to the law of short fiber rubber composite. The reason for it is explained.

QxrNNNBQ.title: Mechanistic studies of the effect of stearic acid coated Mg(OH)_2 on properties of EVA/Mg(OH)_2 composites
QxrNNNBQ.abstract: In this paper,FTIR spectroscopy was employed to evaluate the effect on Mg(OH)_2 of coating the surface with stearic acid.It was found that there was no one optimum loading.It is proposed that the surface modification involves two important processes: one is a type of weak esterification and the other is the acid-base interaction between stearic acid and Mg(OH)_2.Both these reactions were favored by increasing the amount of stearic acid.Moreover,the amount of surface modifier had a significant influence on the properties of EVA/Mg(OH)_2 composites.A continuous decrease in tensile strength and increase in elongation at break of the composites were observed with increasing amount of stearic acid.Meanwhile the flame retardancy of the composites was poorer however compared with that of composites filled with uncoated Mg(OH)_2.However,surface modification of Mg(OH)_2 by stearic acid facilitated the processing of the composites.

8ERgsimZ.title: Preparation and properties of MWCNT/poly(glycerol-sebacate-citrate) elastomer composite
8ERgsimZ.abstract: A poly(glycerol-sebacate-citrate)(PGSC) elastomer was synthesized by melting copolycondensation,then a MWCNT/PGSC composite was prepared by semi-in-situ polymerization and grinding dispersion method,and the properties of composite were investigated.The results showed that the MWCNT had little effect on the glass transition temperature of PGSC;as the addition level of MWCNT increased,the elastic modulus and tensile strength of MWCNT/PGSC composite increased,the swelling degree and water absorption decreased;when the addition level of MWCNT reached or exceeded 1 phr,the elastic modulus and tensile strength of MWCNT/PGSC composite were higher than those of PGSC,and the degradation rate was lower.

PKPEPA2R.title: Flame Retardancy of EVA Filled by Mg(OH)_2 and Al(OH)_3
PKPEPA2R.abstract: Al(OH)_3 and Mg(OH)_2 powder,which had similar shape and particle size and distribution, were employed as halogen-free flame retardants for EVA.The effect of the araount of two flame retar- dants on the mechanical and flame retardant properties of the composites were discussed and compared with the composites containing red phosphorus.The effects of Al(OH)_3 and Mg(OH)_2 were similar in the improvement of flame retardant properties and tensile strength,accompanied with decrease of elon- gation at break.However,shown by cone calorimeter,Al(OH)_3 was superior to Mg(OH) in the shorter ignite time,lower rate of heat release,and higher flame performance index.Red phosphorus had slight effect on the mechanical properties of composites,but a large effect on the flame retardancy.The combi- nation of Mg(OH)_2 and red phosphorus was better for limit oxygen index of EVA composites,however, considering the level and vertical flame behaviors,the combination of Al(OH)_3 and red phosphorus was superior.

63bJMU6D.title: Progress of Dielectric Elastomers
63bJMU6D.abstract: The types,properties,preparation methods and main developing trend of dielectric elastomers were viewed,and the characterization methods of actuation performance of dielectric elastomer actuator were reviewed.Otherwise,some suggestions were taken on the preparation of high dielectric permittivity,low modulus dielectric elastomers.

1PBxKkiV.title: Preparation of composite latexes with different core components and the influence on the pressure-sensitive properties
1PBxKkiV.abstract: The full P(BA-co-AA), PMMA/P(BA-co-AA) and MPS-SiO2/P(BA-co-AA) composite latexes were synthesized through a semi-continuous emulsion polymerization. The percent conversion and the particle size of composite latexes were measured by gravimetric analysis and the Dynamic Light Scattering online. The results show that the instantaneous conversions are higher than 90% and the overall conversions are over 98%. The z-average particle sizes are the same for the three kinds of composite latexes with different core components. The emulsion was coated onto the PET film to measure the adhesive properties (tack force, peel strength and shear resistance) according to FINAT testing methods. The thermal properties of pressure-sensitive adhesives (PSAs) were determined by thermogravimetric analyses (TGA) and the mechanical properties of PSAs were characterized by Dynamic Mechanical Analysis. The results show that embedding nanosilica into acrylic matrix is favorable to improve the thermal property and increase the shear resistance while keeping the relative high values of tack force and peel strength.

Z63N4kYT.title: Effect of epoxidized natural rubber on the properties of rectorite/carbon black/natural rubber nanocomposites
Z63N4kYT.abstract: Epoxidized natural rubber (ENR) was introduced into rectorite (REC)/carbon black/natural rubber (NR) nanocomposites by two ways: (1) the direct incorporation of ENR and (b) the incorporation of a spray-dried REC/ENR compound. Transmission electron microscopy and X-ray diffraction analysis showed that the REC layers presented a nanodispersion structure in the REC/ENR compound. The vulcanization characteristics indicated that ENR increased the crosslinking density of the composites. The stronger reaction between the REC layers and ENR was verified by Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy in the spray-dried REC/ENR compound blended with NR versus that in the REC/NR master batch blended with ENR. As a result, the physical properties, such as the mechanical properties, cutting and chipping resistance, and abrasion resistance, of the composites were greatly increased by the addition of the REC/ENR compound. Copyright © 2012 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.

cq25LH5Q.title: Macro Properties of Polyurethane Elastomers Based on Different Polyols
cq25LH5Q.abstract: Four kinds of polyurethane(PU) elastomers were synthesized from polytetrahydrofuran polyols(PTMG),polycaprolactone polyol(PCL),and 4,4′-diphenylmethane diisocyanate with 1,4-butanediol as a chain extender and trihydroxy polyether polyols as a crosslinker.The effects of the alteration of the PTMG and PCL molecular weight on the mechanical,thermal,and rheological properties of the PU elastomers were studied by means of unversal testing machine,dynamic mechanical thermal analysis(DMTA),differential scanning calorimetry(DSC),and ARES rheometer.It was revealed that PCL-based PU elastomers had higher tensile strength,hardness,plateau modulus,soft segment glass transition temperature,and the apparent viscosity of reaction system than PTMG-based PU elastomers,while PTMG-based PU elastomers showed higher hysteresis loss.It was also found that the above properties depended on the molecular weight of polyols in PU elastomers synthesized from the same kind of polyols.

Mcy23hBB.title: Effect of Water Swelling on Mechanical Properties of Starch/SBR Composites
Mcy23hBB.abstract: The water swelling and the mechanical properties of starch/SBR and starch/carbon black/SBR composites after 90-day water immersion at the room temperature were investigated.The results showed that the water swelling of composites increased with increasing starch loading.After 90-day water immersion at the room temperature,the weight increase of the starch/SBR composites and starch/carbon black/SBR composites containing 20 phr starch was 8.5% and 7.5%,respectively.In the range of 20 phr starch,during 90-day water immersion,the mechanical properties of starch/carbon black/SBR composites,pure SBR vulcanizate and carbon black/SBR composites exhibited the similar change trend with increasing time of water immersion.The mechanical properties of starch/carbon black/SBR composites fluctuated within 30-day water immersion;while after 90-day water immersion,the mechanical properties of the composites were almost the same as those before water immersion.

k7yXbmiv.title: Preparation of Short Carbon Nanotubes(CNTs) through Ball Milling and Properties of Short CNTs/NR Composites
k7yXbmiv.abstract: The carbon nanotubes(CNTs)were chopped through ball milling,and the properties of short CNTs/NR composites were studied.The results showed that CNTs could observably improve the modulus at 100% and 300% elongation of NR,and as the milling time extended,the tube length decreased,and the modulus of short CNTs/NR composites decreased.The thermal conductivity of composites maintained almost unchanged when the milling time was less than 5h,and then dropped down otherwise.

B9iDHF4i.title: Preparation and properties of hindered phenol AO-80/polyester-based polyurethane thermoplastic elastomer composite
B9iDHF4i.abstract: A hindered phenol AO-80/polyester-based polyurethane thermoplastic elastomer(PES-TPU) composite was prepared by melt blending,and its properties were investigated.The results showed that the hindered phenol AO-80 showed amorphous state in the hindered phenol AO-80/PES-TPU composite,and the compatibility between hindered phenol AO-80 and PES-TPU was good;the peak value of tanδ of hindered phenol AO-80/PES-TPU composite increased,the peak position of tanδ moved to higher temperature zone,and the damping property of the composite was improved,but the tensile properties reduced as the addition level of hindered phenol AO-80 increased.

GbgGtu3Z.title: Effect of Nano-CaCO_3 on Properties of EPDM/Polypropylene Thermoplastic Vulcanizate
GbgGtu3Z.abstract: The effects of nano-CaCO3 on the properties of ethylene propylene diene monomer/polypropylene thermoplastic vulcanizate(EPDM/PP TPV) were researched.The results showed that the mechanical properties such as the tensile strength,tear strength and the elongation at break increased at first,and then decreased as the amounts of nano-CaCO3 increasing.The hardness of EPDM/PP TPV increased with nano-CaCO3 increasing,but after the amount of filler exceeding 40phr its hardness didn't increased markedly.The results of DMTA showed that Tg of elastomer phase in TPV increased with the mount of nano-CaCO3 increasing,but the peak of tanδ at this temperature decreased.With the amount of nano-CaCO3 increasing,the elasticity of TPV decreased,but its melt viscosity increased.

MdDch3GT.title: Numerical investigation of the effect of particle spatial distribution on the thermal conductivity of composites
MdDch3GT.abstract: The effect of the particle spatial distribution on the thermal conductivity of composites and the essential condition of the formation of the effective thermal conductive pathways were investigated. In order to solve the modeling problem of the representative volume element (RVE) with any volume fraction and specified spatial configuration, the strategy to describe the objective spatial distribution configuration by the spatial distribution potential-energy function was employed, and a Monte Carlo controllable spatial distribution algorithm was designed, which can effectively create the RVE containing cluster and network configurations with any volume fraction. The simulated results show that, at the same volume fraction, the network configuration is easier to form the thermal conductive pathways and features higher thermal conductivity than the cluster one does; the volume fraction plays a key role in the formation of the effective thermal conductive pathways, which can occur only when the volume fraction is larger than 20% and the distance between the particles is short to some extent; with the increasing distance between the particles, the thermal conduction decreases in an exponent form. Therefore, a given amount of volume fraction and relative effective distribution of particles become two essential conditions of the formation of the effective thermal conductive pathways.
keywords: Monte Carlo controllable spatial distribution algorithm

dH2r2PiJ.title: Effect of cure methods on clay dispersion state in rubber/clay nanocomposites
dH2r2PiJ.abstract: Rubber/clay nanocomposites were prepared by melt intercalation and atmospheric pressure cure,and compared with the rubber/clay nanocomposites prepared by mould pressure cure. The influence of cure method on microdispersion of rubber/clay nanocomposites was studied.The results showed that the original intercalated structure of rubber/clay nanocomposites was not stable in the conditions of high temperature and pressure; the intercalated structures and their spatial distributions in the matrix were extensively altered by the pressing treatment. The effect of pressure during the cure on microstructure of rubber/clay nanocomposites was investigated by transmission electron microscopy(TEM) and wide angle X-ray diffraction(WAXD). The results revealed that the clay dispersion state in isobutylene-isoprene rubber/clay nanocomposites and styrene-butadiene rubber/clay nanocomposites were different at mould pressure and atmospheric pressure cure. Finally, obviating pressure effect, the desirable morphology structure of the dispersed silicate layers could be obtained by atmospheric pressure cure.

l5MOMex3.title: Modification of Asphalt by Crumb Rubber
l5MOMex3.abstract: The asphalt which was modified by crumb rubber with high performance and good dispersibility was prepared by wet blending with asphalt matrix(AH-90,Qinhuangdao),crumb rubber,plasticizer and home-made resin under the condition of high-shear mixer and the temperature of 140℃.After studying the dosage of crumb rubber,plasticizer resin and the size of crumb rubber,the influencing factors and the mechanics of the asphalt modified by crumb rubber were analyzed.

0QwbU8rw.title: Proparation of A Structured Acrylic Copolymer and Its Application in Rigid PVC Foam Products
0QwbU8rw.abstract: PMMA/Poly(MMA-co-St-co-AN),PMSN,with core-shell structured copolymer was prepared by seeded emulsion polymerization.The monomer conversion is high and the particle diameter distribution monitored by dynamic light scattering is narrow.This results show that the particles grow without significantly secondary nucleation occurring and the latex particle size can be designed.Meanwhile,the intrinsic viscosity [η] for the soluble polymer of PMSN in butanone increases with the addition of allyl methacrylate (AMA).When PMSN is blended with low molecular weight poly(vinyl chloride)(PVC) resin,the melt equilibrium torque is increased with the increase of intrinsic viscosity of PMSN.Extrusion of rigid foam is the most demanding PVC process in terms of melt strength.Since the final targeted density can typically be a third of that of compact PVC,high melt strength is essential to retain gas bubbles in the melt and to avoid a collapse of the cells.Finally,the PMSN process aid synthesized meets the industrial requirements of rigid PVC foam.

w4DYHJUZ.title: Study on Performance of Asphalt Modified with Ultra-fine Full-vulcanized SBR Powder
w4DYHJUZ.abstract: The basic performance and hot storage stability of asphalt modified with ultra-fine full-vulcanized SBR powder(UFPSBR) were investigated,in which UFPSBR was prepared by in-situ process at low temperature and high shear.The results showed that,with the addition level of UFPSBR increasing,the penetration at 25 ℃ of asphalt decreased,and the softening point increased.By adding compatibilizer,the equivalent softening point(T800) of asphalt increased,and the equivalent breaking point(T1.2) decreased.Without compatibilizer,UFPSBR in asphalt agglomerated.By adding compatibilizer,the compatibility between asphalt and UFPSBR enhanced,and relatively stable phase boundaries were formed.The compatibilizer could greatly enhance the hot storage stability of asphalts modified with UFPSBR.

iqdOZUOU.title: Properties of intumescent flame retardant ethylene propylene diene monomer/polypropylene thermoplastic vulcanizate
iqdOZUOU.abstract: The influence of adding order of the intumescent flame retardant ammonium polyphosphate(APP) and pentaerythritol(PER) on the vulcanizing behavior of ethylene propylene diene monomer/polypropylene (EPDM/PP) blends were investigated. The effects of APP, PER,melamine(MEL) and their synergistic agents zinc borate(ZB), organic montmorillonite(OMMT) on the properties of EPDM/PP thermoplastic vulcanizate(TPV) were studied. The results showed that EPDM/PP blends could not be vulcanized when APP or PER was added before dynamic vulcanization. The comprehensive mechanical properties were good while 30 phr APP was added. The flame retardant property raised, but the tensile strength decreased with increasing amounts of APP, PER and MEL.The optimum amounts of APP,PER,MEL were 30,10,10 phr respectively. The apparent viscosity of TPV filled with 30 phr APP,10 phr PER and 10 phr MEL was similar to EPDM/PP TPV without flame retardant.The tensile strength of the system decreased while ZB or OMMT was added, and the flame retardant effect of OMMT was better than that of ZB. The apparent viscosity of OMMT system declined at lower shear rate, but raised at higher shear rate. To ZB system,the apparent viscosity had no change at lower shear rate and the viscosity raised at higher shear rate.

OJiMCtep.title: Preparation of acrylic core/shell polymer and its application in toughening rigid PVC matrix
OJiMCtep.abstract: Poly(n-butyl acrylate)/poly(methyl methacrylate) core/shell polymer (ACR) was prepared by semi-continuous emulsion polymerization. The instantaneous conversion is higher than 85% and overall conversion is over 95%. Comparison of theoretically calculated particle diameters with those measured experimentally show that the particles have grown without significant secondary nucleation occurring. The TEM analysis verified the morphology and the particle size. When it was used to modify PVC matrix, the PVC/ACR blend occurres brittle-ductile transition with the addition of 3 phr ACR. The Charpy impact strength reaches 16.51 kJ/m2, while the tensile keeps a relative high value (61.37 MPa). The SEM observation was used to explain the toughening mechanism. The ACR modifier is dispersed homogeneously in the PVC matrix, and the fractured surfaces show the networked structure and ductile deformation. The particle with approximately 180 nm of rubber-phase yields the effective impact absorption while minimizing the loss of tensile properties. This result will be used in the industrial scale in the nearest future.

dVGPFbUb.title: Design and Heat Balance Calculation of Screw Conveyor for Rubber Desulfurization
dVGPFbUb.abstract: A new technology of waste rubber dynamic desulfurization including intermittent unloading from several devulcanizers,continuous transportation by screw conveyor and cooling in agitator tank could be used to effectively reduce environmental pollution in the current desulfurization process.Based on this new equipment,a theoretical calculation method was developed to analyze the screw transportation and heat transfer ability.The influence of force exerted on materials and friction on the conveying process was analyzed,the parameters of screw transportation was designed and verified,and the heat equilibrium of cooling process was calculated.

8VHPKhjd.title: Structures and properties of rectorite/NR nanocomposites
8VHPKhjd.abstract: The structures and properties of rectorite/NR composites prepared by emulsion method and melt method respectively were investigated.The results showed that the emulsion method rectorite/NR composite was a typical "separated" nanocomposite,in which no polymer molecule was intercalated into the rectorite layers,and in contrast,the melt method rectorite/NR composite was a typical intercalated nanocomposite;the stress of the melt method nanocomposite was greater as the strain was lower than 100%,and the stress of the emulsion method nanocomposite was greater as the strain was higher than 100%;the tear strength of the emulsion method nanocomposite was higher than that of the melt method nanocomposite as the proportion of rectorite was lower;and the thermal stabilities of the both nanocomposites were similar to each other and better than that of pure NR compound.

Ssspr1yD.title: Design and preparation of novel bioengineering rubber
Ssspr1yD.abstract: A novel bioengineering rubber——poly(butanediol/propanediol/sebacic acid/itaconic acid)(PBPSI)copolyester was prepared with 1,3-propanediol,1,4-butanediol,sebacic acid and itaconic acid by melting polycondensation method,and the structure and properties of PBPSI were characterized by FTIR,GPC and DSC.The results showed that,the molecular weight of PBPSI was high,the glass transition temperature was far lower than room temperature,and the physical properties and environmental stability were good.

M0EBFmNl.title: Study on thermal conductivity of nano-zinc oxide/SSBR composite
M0EBFmNl.abstract: The influence of the addition level of nano-zinc oxide on the thermal conductivity of nano-zinc oxide/solution polymerized butadiene styrene rubber(SSBR) composite was investigated. The results showed that as the addition level of nano-zinc oxide increased,the tensile strength and tear strength increased first and then tended to be stabilized,thermal conductivity and Payne effect increased,the thermal conducting network of nano-zinc oxide gradually improved,and difference between the measured thermal conductivity and the theoretical value calculated by Nielsen model was not significant.

NeENGORY.title: Radiation-proof and rheological properties of samarium oxide/thermoplastic polyurethane composites
NeENGORY.abstract: Sm2O3/thermoplastic polyurethane(TPU) composites were prepared by mechanical blending processing,the radiation-proof and rheological properties of Sm2O3/TPU composites were investigated.The results showed that the radiation-proof property was improved with increase of the amount of Sm2O3 under the same testing voltage.The radiation-proof property of the composite at 120 kV was better than that one at 60 kV when the amounts of Sm2O3 were the same.Meanwhile,the radiation-proof property of Sm2O3/TPU composite was superior than Sm2O3/nature rubber and PbO/nature rubber which used nature rubber as matrix.Melt of Sm2O3/TPU composite was a kind of pseudoplastic fluid.When the amount of Sm2O3 reached 500 phr,the dispersion of its particles was the best and the flow-ability of the composite was better.

459ylBma.title: Composition and crystallization property of biodegradable poly-(sebacic-co- propanetriol) elastomer
459ylBma.abstract: A kind of biodegradable poly(sebacic-co-propanetriol) ester elastomer(PGS) was synthesized by condensing sebacic acid and propanetriol with different mole ratio and its composition and crystallization property were characterized by swelling test, X-ray diffraction and differential scanning calorimetry.The results showed that PGS was a polyester with low crosslinking density, and composed of sol and gel with sol content more than 75%.The glass transition temperature of PGS was below -25 ℃.PGS was a crystallizable elastomer and had microphase separation structure with crystal regions and amorphous regions with increasing the sebacic acid.

T7Usmp5l.title: Structure and property of IIR/PP thermoplastic vulcanizate. I: Effect of softening agent and filler on structure and property of IIR/PP TPV
T7Usmp5l.abstract: The structure and properties of IIR/PP thermoplastic vulcanizates with different content of oil and silica were investigated, especially the rheological property and elasticity property. For the first time, the morphology was got by diluting the IIR/PP TPV using PP. The results showed that, the effect of oil on the flow property was very notable, oil could greatly improve the flow property of TPV, but the effect of silica on TPV mechanical properties was not evident. Based on this study, the new mechanism and idea for the effect of oil on flow property was brought forward, which was, during dynamic vulcanization, the crushing efficiency of rubber was enhanced by adding softening agent. At the same time, there was some oil migrated into PP, as the result, the viscosity of matrix decreased. It was because of above two efficiencies that the flow property of TPV was improved.

RXNEcwPG.title: Effect of Resorcinol━Formaldehyde on the Structure and  Properties of Starch/SBR Composites
RXNEcwPG.abstract: Starch/styrene butadiene rubber(SBR) composites were prepared by latex compounding method(LCM),and the resorcinol-formaldehyde(RF) prepared in our lab was used as the modifier of starch.The effect of the loading of RF on the structure and properties of starch/SBR composites were studied here.The results showed that the properties of the composites had significant improvement just by introducing little amount of RF;The stress,tensile strength and tear strength improved further more;and finely with the increasing loading of RF,1.2phr RF was considered to be the optimal amount to starch/SBR composites with 10phr starch.

5EMeTGf1.title: Grafting of polyester onto graphene for electrically and thermally conductive composites
5EMeTGf1.abstract: Many reported polymer/graphene composites, even some with excellent graphene dispersion, do not possess impressive conductivity, which may be due to the failure in forming interconnected conductive paths. In this work, a kind of bio-based polyester (BE) is synthesized by polycondensation between plant-derived diols and diacids. It is then grafted onto graphene oxide (GO) via the easterification between hydroxyls of BE and carboxyls of GO. Subsequently, the grafted GO is subjected to reduce by vitamin C. Because of the presence of terminal hydroxyl group in both ends of the BE chains and multiple carboxyl groups on GO, the grafts form specific spatial interconnection structure in BE matrix. The resulting BE/graphene composites possess impressive low threshold percolation of electrical conductivity, in combination of high thermal conductivity. © 2012 American Chemical Society.

3jKJdayq.title: Study on Absorbing-wave Properties of Magnetic Fillers/Silicone Rubber Composite
3jKJdayq.abstract: Effects of various contents of magnetic fillers such as Sr-ferrite and carbonyl-iron(CI) on the Absorbing characteristics and mechanical properties of MVQ were studied respectively.The results showed that ferrite and CI had the same trend that their reflectivity moved to lower frequencies and mechanical properties decreased with the increase of fillers loading;By comparison,ferrite Absorbing rubber had the quality of wide-band and highly Absorbing capacity which was suitable for higher frequencies such as X,Ku-band(8～12GHz),while CI Absorbing rubber had narrow-band at lower frequencies such as S,C-band(2～8GHz).

4rdnhRcu.title: Study on flame retardance of EPDM/PP TPV
4rdnhRcu.abstract: The effect of the primary flame retardant magnesium hydroxide [Mg(OH)_2] combined with decabromo diphenylethane(DBDPE)/antimonous oxide(Sb_2O_3)/ingredient A——a polymerized organo-silicone on the properties of EPDM/PP TPV was investigated.The results showed that the physical properties of EPDM/PP TPV would decrease by adding Mg(OH)_2;the flame retardance of EPDM/PP TPV improved significantly by using Mg(OH)_2 combined with DBDPE and Sb_2O_3,and the physical properties and rheological properties changed little;and the oxidative index of EPDM/PP TPV increased remarkably and the rheological properties improved by adding ingredient A,but the physical properties decreased.The optimized flame-retardant formula of EPDM/PP TPV was as follows:EPDM/PP TPV 100,Mg(OH)_2 50,DBDPE 20,Sb_2O_3 7,ingredient A 5.

YR0DLOZK.title: Process utilized oligo-β-cyclodextrin substituted agarose gel medium for efficient purification of paclitaxel from Taxus cuspidata
YR0DLOZK.abstract: An efficient and economical process utilized oligo-β-cyclodextrin substituted agarose gel medium has been developed for paclitaxel recovery and purification directly from the plant materials of Taxus cuspidata . The process is a combination of extraction, alkaline Al 2 O 3 chromatography step, oligo-β-cyclodextrin substituted agarose gel column chromatography which employed a novel oligo-β-cyclodextrin-Sepharose HP as the packing material, and crystallization. The Al 2 O 3 normal-phase chromatography was used to obtain a preliminary isolation of paclitaxel from largely unwanted compounds in crude extract. The highest selectivity for paclitaxel was obtained on the oligo-β-cyclodextrin-Sepharose HP column compared with other β-cyclodextrin coupled gel media columns. The initial separation extract on Al 2 O 3 column was purified by the subsequent oligo-β-cyclodextrin-Sepharose HP column chromatography with a purity of about 95.3% and a recovery of 87.1% under the optimum mobile phase composed of methanol/acetonitrile/water = 32/20/48 (v/v/v). One-step crystallization can increase the product purity up to 97.3%. HPLC analysis and ESI-MS/MS spectrum were used for the detection and characterization of paclitaxel in isolated fraction. Keywords β-Cyclodextrin Stationary phase Chromatography Paclitaxel Purification

cTIRpJzd.title: Surface-silvered polyimide films prepared by plasma-induced grafting of viologen and electroless plating
cTIRpJzd.abstract: A vinyl-containing viologen, 1,1'-bis(4-vinylbenzyl)-4,4'-bipyridinium dinitrate (VBVN), was synthesized and subsequently graft-copolymerized on argon plasma-pretreated polyimide (PI) films. Silver nanoparticles can be deposited on the surface of the PI grafted with VBVN film through photo-induced reduction of the silver ions in salt solution. The surface compositions of the modified PI films were studied by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS). The topography of the electroless deposited PI films was characterized by SEM and AFM. The results show that the silver nanoparticles are uniformly distributed on the surface of PI films, and the size and distribution of the nanoparticles can be varied by changing the UV irradiation time.

WT2Be0Xc.title: Preparation and characteristics of starch/polyvinyl alcohol compound bio-membrane
WT2Be0Xc.abstract: BACKGROUND: There is no study on starch/polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as guided tissue regeneration membranes. The guided tissue regeneration membrane with porous structure were prepared, which combined with the advantages of natural polymer and synthetic polymer. OBJECTIVE: To research the effects of the preparation conditions on the properties of starch/PVA membranes. METHODS: The porous membranes of guiding tissue regeneration were prepared mainly by starch and PVA through solution mixing, casting, freezing and drying. The effects of the mass ratio of PVA and starch, solution concentration, and pre-freezing temperature on the properties of the membrane were researched. The surface morphology, tensile strength, porous ratio, water absorbance and cell cytotoxicity were characterized. RESULTS AND CONCLUSION: The aperture of the membrane was 1-50 μm, the porosity was 60%-70%, and the tensile strength was 12-26 MPa. And this membrane had the excellent biocompatibility and hydrophilicity. The pores in the surface were evenly distributed with the solution concentration of 5% and the pre-freezing temperature of-30 °C. The more content of starch was, and the larger of the aperture was.

3foaAyvR.title: Properties of clay/carbon black/NR composite
3foaAyvR.abstract: A clay/carbon black/NR nano-composite was obtained by adding carbon black on two-roll mill into clay/NR nano-composite which was prepared with emulsion intercalating method,and its micro-structure and properties were investigated by XRD and TEM.The results showed that the addition of carbon black had no effect on the dispersion of clay in NR matrix,and both fillers were(dispersed) in NR matrix on nanoscale;the addition of carbon black decreased the intensity of filler network formed by clay to improve the processibility of composite;and the comprehensive physical pro-(perties) of clay/carbon black/NR nano-composite were better than those of clay/NR nano-composite.

lbqW4rAR.title: Interface compatability between waste rubber powder and high density polyethylene resin
lbqW4rAR.abstract: The interface compatability between waste rubber powder(WRP) and high density polyethylene(HDPE) improved by using the compatabilizer and the modifier was studied,the thermal dynamic properties,dynamic mechanical properties and micro-structure morphology of the WRP/HDPE blends were investigated.The results showed that the addition of the modifier and the interface compatabilizer improved the interface compatibility and the mechanical properties of the WRP/HDPE blends.

eJHjyRz4.title: Preparation and properties of aramid pulp/HNBR composite
eJHjyRz4.abstract: The influence of the pretreating method on the dispersion of aramid pulp in rubber matrix and the properties of aramid pulp/HNBR composite was experimentally investigated.The results showed that the dispersion of aramid pulp in composite was improved by the pretreatment of aramid pulp;the modulus and tensile strength of composite increased when the aramid pulp was pretreated with silica,at the same time the elongation at break decreased and the physical properties at high temperature improved a little;the improvement was not remarkable as the aramid pulp was pretreated by coprecipitation method;as the proportion of silica-pretreated aramid pulp increased and the mixing time kept constant,the physical properties of composite increased,but the tear strength at high temperature decreased;the aramid was easily oriented in the aramid pulp/HNBR composite;and the extrudability of compound improved as the proportion of aramid pulp increased.

mGR3zQAu.title: Preparation of core-shell structured polymer and its application in toughening polystyrene
mGR3zQAu.abstract: The authors prepared a kind of core-shell structured polymer from n-butyl acrylate and styrene via seed emulsion polymerization, and studied the effect of mass ratio of core to shell monomer on emulsion polymerization process. The result verifies that the total conversion of the monomers exceeds 98%. On the assumption that the latex particles present and grow in the shape of sphere, the theoretical particle diameter of the latexes is consistent with the actually measured value; the fact reveals that there exists no significant secondary nucleation in the polymerization system. As the mass ratio of core to shell monomer rises, no obvious variation in glass transition temperature (T g) of the low temperature zone [poly(n-butyl acrylate) zone] appears while a declining trend in T g of high temperature zone (polystyrene zone) occurs. This phenomenon demonstrates the existence of the transition layer formed on the interface of the core-shell structure. When blending the emulsion polymer with polystyrene (PS), the impact strength of the blending increases at first and decreases with that as the mass ratio of core to shell monomer augments, that means there are optimum conditions suitable for toughening PS with the core-shell structured polymer.

12QvDTah.title: Effect of the compatibility on the morphology and properties of acrylonitrile-butadiene rubber/polypropylene thermoplastic vulcanizates
12QvDTah.abstract: In this study, the morphologies of three types of acrylonitrile-butadiene rubber (NBR)/polypropylene (PP) thermoplastic vulcanizates (TPVs) (with an NBR/PP blend ratio of 70/30) were compared. The TPVs were (1) an ultrafine fully vulcanized acrylonitrile-butadiene rubber (UFNBR)/PP TPV made by the mechanical blending of UFNBR with PP, (2) a dynamically vulcanized NBR/PP TPV without the compatibilization of maleic anhydride grafted polypropylene (MP) and amine-terminated butadiene-acrylonitrile copolymer (ATBN), and (3) a dynamically vulcanized NBR/PP TPVs with the compatibilization of MP and ATBN. The influence of the compatibility therein on the size of the dispersed vulcanized NBR particles and the crystallization behavior of the PP in the TPVs and the resultant properties are also discussed. As indicated by Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy, scanning electron microscopy, differential scanning calorimetry, polarizing microscopy, dynamic mechanical thermal analysis, and rheological and mechanical testing, the compatibility was significantly improved by the reactive compatibilization of MP and ATBN, which led to a uniform and fine morphology. The compatibilization increased the crystallization rate and reduced the size of the spherulites of PP. On the other hand, it was found that the dispersed vulcanized NBR particles lowered the degree of crystallinity. The better the compatibility of the blend was, the lower the degree of crystallinity and the storage modulus were, but the higher the loss factor and the processing viscosity were. All TPVs showed almost the same oil resistance, but the TPV prepared with reactive compatibilization had the best mechanical properties. © 2011 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.

fKdB8KUd.title: Study on Rheological Behavior of APAO Hot-melt Pressure Sensitive Adhesive
fKdB8KUd.abstract: The influence of tackifying resin and plasticizer on the rheological behavior of atactic polymerized alpha olefin(APAO) based hot-melt pressure sensitive adhesive was investigated by means of an Advanced Rheology Expansion System(ARES).It indicated that the shear viscosity of the adhesive increased with increasing molecular weight of APAO.With the increase of C5 petroleum resin content,the shear viscosity achieved a peak value.The smaller the molecular weight of plasticizer was,the smaller the shear viscosity was,but there was no influence on the shear sensitivity with different plasticizers.APAO hot-melt pressure sensitive adhesive had a strong temperature sensitivity.The shear sensitivity increased as shear rate enhanced or temperature decreased.

5CdXxbHc.title: Preparation and properties of nitrile rubber/hindered phenol AO-80 composites reinforced with carbon black
5CdXxbHc.abstract: The nitrile rubber(NBR)/hindered phenol(AO-80)/ carbon black(N 220) composites were prepared by filling AO-80 and N 220 into NBR.The thermal property,dynamic mechanical property,mechanical properties and thermal aging resistance of the composites were studied.The results showed that the glass transition temperature of the composites were close to that of NBR/AO-80 composites,and both higher than that of pure NBR.Moreover,the NBR/AO-80/N 220 composites showed high loss peak values more than 1.19,and the effective damping temperature ranges(loss factor no less than 0.3) were about 36 ℃,indicating a good damping property.The storage modulus(E′)of the NBR/AO-80/N 220 composites was larger than that of NBR/AO-80 composites,and with increasing N 220 amount,E′ of NBR/AO-80/N 220 composites increased gradually,and the tensile strength,modulus at 100%,modulus at 300%,tear strength and elongation at break as well.The optimum amount of N 220 was 30 phr.The NBR/AO-80/N 220 composites had good thermal aging resistance.

sQnEkbcW.title: Structure and properties of hindered phenol AO-80/polyether-based polyurethane thermoplastic elastomer composites
sQnEkbcW.abstract: The blend of hindered phenol AO-80 and polyether-based polyurethane thermoplastic elastomer(PET-TPU) were prepared by melt-blending method.Microstructure,glass transition tempe-rature(Tg),dynamic mechanical properties and mechanical properties of the composites were investigated by scanning electronic microscope,X-ray diffraction,differential scanning calorimetric analysis and dynamic mechanical thermo analyzer.The results showed that AO-80 molecule dissolved in the matrix in a molecule level because of the excellent compatibility,and AO-80 existed as amorphous state in the composites.With the AO-80 loading increasing in the composites,the Tg of the soft segment rised gradually,and the Tg of the hard segment almost had no change.The loss factor(tan δ)-temperature curves of AO-80/PET-TPU composites presented a single peak,and the tan δ peak value increased prominently and the range of the transition became slightly wider.The mechanical properties of the matrix were reduced by adding AO-80.

ODyFCldc.title: Structure and properties of acrylonitrile-butadiene rubber/poly(vinyl chloride)/hindered phenol AO-60 blends
ODyFCldc.abstract: The structure of acrylonitrile-butadiene rubber/poly(vinyl chloride)/hindered phenol tetrakis[methylene-3-(3,5-ditert butyl-4-hydroxy phenyl) propionyloxy]methane(NBR/PVC/AO-60) blends was characterized by differential scanning calorimetry, X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscope and elemental analysis. Damping properties and mechanical properties were studied. The results showed that most of the AO-60 molecules was amorphous in the blend when the amount of AO-60 was lower than 50 phr. AO-60 molecules could form crystal in the matrix with adding overdose of AO-60. The island phase mostly composed of PVC and AO-60 molecules, the continuous phase was mostly consisted of NBR. Doublet transition of the NBR /PVC /AO-60 blends appeared above the glass transition temperature of the NBR/PVC matrix and it increased as increasing amount of AO-60. The mechanical properties of NBR /PVC /AO-60 blends was better with adding 50 phr of AO-60.

NmmrJ48T.title: Remove rhodium catalysts from HNBR solution
NmmrJ48T.abstract: Rhodium complex is excellent catalyst for nitrile-butadiene rubber homogeneous hydrogenation with difficulties in its recovery. A new extraction method for recovery noble metal catalysts from hydrogenated nitrile-butadiene rubber solution was investigated. Rhodium metal catalysts can be efficiently, easily removed from hydrogenated nitrile-butadiene rubber solution using amine as ligand and hydrogen peroxide as oxidant. The condition of removing noble metal catalysts from hydrogenated nitrile-butadiene rubber solution was carefully studied, including oxidant, reaction temperature, and the concentration of amine. The removal rate of the rhodium catalyst over 96% with the optimal conditions.1H-NMR characterization showed that there was no change in the structure and nitrile group of hydrogenated nitrile-butadiene rubber after rhodium catalysts were removed. © (2011) Trans Tech Publications, Switzerland.

oLAjFBr7.title: Study on high functional modification of silica and properties of filled SBR compound
oLAjFBr7.abstract: The silica was modified by silane coupling agent KH-570,and the properties of modified silica filled SBR compound were investigated.The results showed that,the highest functionality of the product was obtained and the organic grafting rate was 16.3%,when the silica was modified by toluene at reflux condition,the ratio of deionized water and coupling agent was 0.35,the hydrolyzing time was 143 min,and the addition level of coupling agent was 8 phr;the dispersion of the modified silica in SBR compound was obviously improved,the optimum cure time was shortened and better comprehensive physical properties were obtained.

kqkBh2Nh.title: Synthesis and properties of degradable elastomer poly[(propanediol-sebacate-citrate]
kqkBh2Nh.abstract: Intermidiate 1,2-propanediol-sebacate was synthesized with 1,2-propanediol and sebacic acid,then a novel degradable elastomer,poly[(propanediol-sebacate)-citrate](PPSC),was synthesized by melt phase polycondensation of 1,2-propanediol-sebacate and citric acid under under certain conditions.Effect of type of catalyst and water-carrying agent,mole ratio of sebacic acid to 1,2-propanediol on the synthesis of intermidiate were investigated,and the intermidiate and PPSC were characterized.The mechanical properties and in vitro degradation of PPSC were primarily studied.The results showed that intermidiate 1,2-propanediol-sebacate of low relative molecular mass was synthesized with toluene-p-sulfoinc acid as catalyst,benzene as water-carrying agent,and of mole ratio of sebacic acid to 1,2-propanediol of 1∶ 4.The glass-transition temperatures of PPSC were below 0 ℃ which confirmed that PPSC would be in a high-elastic state of ambient temperature and human body temperature.PPSC was a elastomer with moderate crosslinkage,low module and high elongation,and had rapid degradation ratio(degradation degree more than 50%) in phosphate(pH value 7.4) at 37 ℃.

MboLNMmA.title: Flame Retarded LDPE by Intumescent Flame Retardant System
MboLNMmA.abstract: The basic properties of ammonium polyphosphate form I(n>30)and ammonium polyphosphate form Ⅱ(n>1000) were compared,and so were the mechanical property and flame retardant property of the corresponding composites.It was found that the addition of APP could enhance the LOI and postpone the decomposition of composites.However,it could also deteriorate the mechanical properties of composites.The same results would occur in the flame retarded composites by APP Ⅰ and APP Ⅱ.Whereas,the surface modification of APP could improve the dispersion of APP in LDPE matrix and their compatibility,which would enhance the mechanical properties of composites.

AONnzLxH.title: Study of Thermoplastic Elastomer and Its Industrialization
AONnzLxH.abstract: Varieties,market situation,industrialized progress and latest research direction of chemical synthesis type TPE and rubber-plastic blending type TPE are reviewed.New thermoplastic elastomer products such as polyamide TPE,thermally reversible covalent crosslinking TPE,metallocene catalytic polyolefin TPE,mesogen-jacketed liquid crystalline TPE,biobased TPE,and new thermoplastic vulcanizate,etc.with broad application prospects are introduced.Preparation methods,performance characteristics and market development of new thermoplastic elastomer products are also discussed in detail.Furthermore,the application fields and the industrialization development of the new thermoplastic elastomer products are predicted.

nwnTcvrq.title: Effect of the charging method of chain-transfer agent on emulsion polymerization process and pressure-sensitive adhesive properties
nwnTcvrq.abstract: The preparation of three kinds of poly (n-butyl acrylate-co-acrylic acid) latexes with different charging methods of chain-transfer agent was reported, and investigations into the pressure-adhesive properties of the latexes were made. The latexes were prepared at a solid content of 50% by a two-stage sequential emulsion polymerization with the monomers n-butyl acrylate (BA) and acrylic acid (AA). Dynamic light scattering was used to monitor the particle diameters and showed that the particles grew without significant secondary nucleation occurring. The molecular parameters were characterized by gel permeation chromatography and dynamic mechanical analysis. The adhesive properties measured were loop tack force, peel strength and shear resistance according to FINAT test methods. The relationship between pressure-sensitive properties and molecular parameters, such as gel content and molecular weight, was evaluated.

qNRRax2Z.title: Research Development of Degradable Bioelastomers
qNRRax2Z.abstract: Degradable bioelastomer belonged to a kind of biomedical polymeric material.It had demonstrated great potential application to the biomedical fields because of its high flexibility and suited mechanical properties to many soft tissues of body.In this paper,a few degradable bioelastomers,which were being widely concerned at present,were reviewed.Furthermore,the author's work on degradable bioelastomers was introduced.

r82eqw3j.title: Progress in Applications of Long Fiber Reinforced Thermoplastics in Automotive Parts
r82eqw3j.abstract: In this paper, the theory, property, application, and manufacture of long fiber reinforced thermoplastics (LFT) in the field of automobile parts were reviewed. LFT satisfied the requirement of high mechanical properties and dimensional stability for the half structure parts and components in the automotive. The development of domestic LFT composite materials was at the stage of preliminary research and application, national standards and mature design and application were absent. The domestic market was basically monopolized by foreign products. Therefore, LFT constituted potential products in our country.

QCRfT9BN.title: Road Performance of Asphalt Modified with Ultra-fine Full-vulcanized SBR Powder
QCRfT9BN.abstract: The asphalt modified with ultra-fine full-vulcanized SBR powder(UFPSBR) was prepared by wet process,and its road performance was investigated.The results showed that,the performance of asphalt modified with UFPSBR basically met the requirements of corresponding standard except the ductility at 5 ℃.UFPSBR was evenly distributed in asphalt to form relatively stable structure,and the compatibility between asphalt and UFPSBR was good.With the addition level of UFPSBR increasing,the size of dispersed UFPSBR particle increased and some particles were slightly agglomerated.By adding UFPSBR,the thermal stability of asphalt increased,the viscosity and elasticity improved significantly,the resistance to external force was improved sharply,and the traffic noise reduced significantly.

tHmAmJLj.title: Study of Non-halogen Flame Retardant Polyolefin Elastomer
tHmAmJLj.abstract: Magnesium Hydroxide (Mg(OH)2) was used as halogen-free flame retardant in the preparation of flame retardant polyolefin elastomer (POE),with the emphasis on the effect of the content of Mg(OH)2 on the mechanical properties,flame retardance,heat resistance,crystallinity and processability of the flame retardant composite.The results showed the increase of the content of Mg(OH)2 could increase the LOI of the composite and upgrade the horizontal and vertical combustion grades of the composite.Only when the mass fraction of Mg(OH)2 was 65%,the flame retardation of the composite was the optimum.Filling of great amount of untreated Mg(OH)2 would lead to rapid decrease of the mechanical properties of the composite,while proper treatment of Mg(OH)2 could improve the mechanical properties of the composite.Mg(OH)2 could improve the heat resistance of the composite and had obvious heterogeneous nucleation for POE.When great amount of Mg(OH)2 was filled to the composite,the modulus of the energy storage and the viscosity of the composite increased obviously.

xGRyRvwh.title: Influential factors on the electrical conductivity of silver-coated glass bead/silicone rubber electrically conductive composite
xGRyRvwh.abstract: The effects of the addition level,particle size and modification technology of silver-coated glass bead and the curing degree of electrically conductive silicone rubber on the electrical conductivity of silver-coated glass bead/silicone rubber composite were investigated.The results showed that the electrical conductivity of the composite was improved as the particle size of silver-coated glass bead increased;the electrical conductivity and its stability of composite prepared with wet pretreatment or in-situ modification-dispersion were better than those of composite prepared with direct dry-mixing;the electrical conductivity of composite was improved as the curing degree of electrically conductive silicone rubber increased;the Payne effect was highly related to the volume resistivity of electrically conductive silicone rubber.

qILDQ0m7.title: Effect of preparation conditions on dielectric and piezoelectric properties of piezoelectric ceramics/acrylonitrile-butadiene rubber composites
qILDQ0m7.abstract: Piezoelectric composites were prepared by using acrylonitrile-butadiene rubber as the matrix and lead magnesite niobate zircomate titanate piezoelectric ceramics powder as the disperse phase,and the change of dielectric and piezoelectric properties of the composites under different polarizing conditions and moulding pressure were studied.The results showed that the dielectric constant increased with the increase of polarizing electric-field intensity,polarizing temperature and moulding pressure,and the piezoelectric constant increased with the increase of polarizing electric-field intensity and moulding pressure,however,the piezoelectric constant has a maximum value at 80 ℃.
keywords: lead magnesite niobate zircomate titanate piezoelectric ceramics

73SYK3G5.title: Study on EPDM/PP TPV
73SYK3G5.abstract: The effects of the preparation and the addition level of flame retarder on the properties of flame retardant EPDM/PP TPV were investigated.The results showed that an EPDM/PP TPV with better flame retardance and somewhat poorer physical properties was obtained by using the blending flame retardant system of decabromo-diphenyl oxide(FR-10)/antimony trioxide(Sb_2O_3) adding the flame retarder before dynamic vulcanization,and an EPDM/NBR TPV with better flame retardance and lower tensile strength was obtained by adding high level of flame retarder;and an EPDM/PP TPV with a little better flame retardance and somewhat poorer physical properties and extrudate appearance was obtained by using the blending flame retardant system of FR-10/Sb_2O_3/magnesium hydroxide [Mg(OH)_2] and adding Mg(OH)_2 before dynamic vulcanization,and the addition level of Mg(OH)_2 had little effect on the flame retardance of EPDM/NBR TPV.A flame retardant EPDM/NBR TPV with low hardness and smoke emission was obtained by using blending flame retardant system of FR-10/Sb_2O_3/Mg(OH)_2 and adding Mg(OH)_2 before dynamic vulcanization.

Q2AXl78r.title: Research on a Rubber Modified Asphalt Viscosity Reducer
Q2AXl78r.abstract: The octadecanamide was used as a viscosity reducer of the mixing process of rubber powder modified asphalt,the flowability was improved and the mixture temperature of rubber powder modified asphalt was decreased. The viscosity of the rubber powder modified asphalt mixed with the viscosity reducer was traced by Brookfield asphalt viscometer. The softening point,penetration and ductility was tested. The principle of viscosity-reducing was characterized by the 4 components of asphalt. The results showed that the viscosity of rubber modified asphalt could be greatly reduced by octadecanamide so that the processing temperature could be lower. And the performance indexes was influenced a little. Viscosity-reducing and performance index arrived at the best balance at 135℃.

HIAIgEEW.title: Self-assemble behavior of amphiphilic diblock copolymer of methoxy poly (ethylene glycol)/polyester
HIAIgEEW.abstract: Amphiphilic diblock copolymers based on methoxy polyethylene glycol (MePEG), 1, 6-hexanediol and maleic anhydride with different molar composition were synthesized by solution polycondensation. Self-assemble behavior of amphiphilic diblock copolymer in different solvents by dialyzing technique was discussed. The micelle morphologhy was observed by TEM. It was found that well core-shell MePEG1900/Polyester 2162 copolymer nanoparticles can be formed by self-assemble in acetone solution. in addition, the size of nanospheres measured using dynamic light scattering exhibited a narrow monodisphere size distribution and an average diameter in the ranger of less than 200nm. © (2011) Trans Tech Publications.

KxCd2N0o.title: Preparation and characterization of a biodegradable poly(sebacic-co-propanetriol) elastomer
KxCd2N0o.abstract: A biodegradable poly(sebacic-co-propanetriol) ester elastomer(PGS) was synthesized with propanetriol and sebacic acid by melting cocondensation.The structure of the PGS was characterized.The mechanical properties,hydrophilicity and degradation of the PGS were discussed.The results showed that the ester bond,carboxyl and hydroxyl groups in the PGS endowed with certain hydrophilicity and biodegradation of PGS. The mechanical properties,hydrophilicity and degradation of the PGS could be adjusted by altering mole ratio of propanetriol and sebacic acid.

gYeXF8o4.title: Cut growth resistance and fracture resistance of clay/carbon black/natural rubber nanocomposites
gYeXF8o4.abstract: Various precut methods were employed to study the cut growth resistance and fracture resistance under static and dynamic conditions of clay/carbon black/natural rubber nano-composites.The results showed that the addition of clay could effectively blunt the crack in the vicinity of the original cut tip and hinder the crack from growing,therefore improved the fracture resistance of natural rubber.Cut and chip tester was used to study the cut and chip resistance and the result showed that cut and chip resistance could be improved with the addition of clay.Adding of clay could improve the abrasion resistance and the flex fatigue life of the composites.

LFI6upRa.title: Study on the Curing Characteristics and Properties of Nickel Coated Graphite/Silicone Rubber Composite
LFI6upRa.abstract: The effect of the amount of the coupling agent,the amount of the conductive filler and the curing temperature on the curing characteristics of the nickel-coated graphite/ silicone rubber composite was investigated in this paper.The results indicated that the coupling agent A-151 containing double bond could react with crossing-linking agent DCBP,consumed the vulcanizer and decreased the cross-linking degree of the composite.Furthermore,the percolation threshold was observed in the nickel-coated graphite/ silicone rubber composite.The electrical properties were improved with the increase of the conductive filler level.In addition,the curing properties became worse when the filler level was higher.When the curing temperature was increased,the cross-linking agent was activated and the cross-linking bond of the composite broke up rapidly.The competition effect made the cross-linking degree raise at the beginning,and then decline.

bilCKPbh.title: Advances in fabrication of polymer fibers by electrospinning
bilCKPbh.abstract: In this paper,the mechanism and the factors of electrospinning process for polymer fiber production are introduced,the research progress in polymer fibers by electrospinning and its application are reviewed.Also,some problems to be solved in future on electrospinning polymer fibers are proposed,and the development prospect of the electrospinning is as well forecasted.

uyOn8W2g.title: Preparation and properties of nitrile rubber/nylon 12 thermoplastic elastomer by dynamic vulcanization
uyOn8W2g.abstract: The nitrile rubber(NBR)/nylon 12(PA 12) thermoplastic elastomers(TPE) were prepared by dynamic vulcanization.The curing time was determined by Haake internal mixer,and the morphological structure was characterized.The effects of NBR/PA 12(mass ratio) and plasticizer types on the properties of TPE were investigated,and the TPE was analyzed by differential scanning calorimetry.The results showed that the TPE behaved as two-phase structure with PA 12 as continuous phase and NBR as dispersed phase.With increasing the PA 12 amount,the tensile strength and oil resistance increased obviously,and the Shore A hardness and compression set increased as well,elongation at break initially decreased and then increased,and the appropriate mass ratio of NBR/PA 12 was 70/30-60/40.The Shore A hardness decreased and elongation at break increased with the addition of dioctyl phthalate,liquid nitrile rubber and polypropylene adipate plasticzers,but the oil resistance was not affected.The melting point of TPE was higher than that of PA 12,and the melting enthalpy was lower than that of PA 12.

zVdT0CIy.title: Preparation, microstructure, and property of silicon rubber/organically modified montmorillonite nanocomposites and silicon rubber/OMMT/fumed silica ternary nanocomposites
zVdT0CIy.abstract: Five different types of organically modified montmorillonites (OMMT), including Nanomor® I.30P, I.44P, I.24TL, I.34TCN, and I.31PS, were incorporated into silicone rubber (SiR), respectively, by using a melt-blending method. The intercalation structure and spatial dispersion of OMMT in the obtained composites were characterized with wide-angle X-ray diffraction and transmission electron microscopy. The results revealed that the high-polar organic intercalants or silane-coupling agent might play the negative roles in the melt intercalation of SiR into OMMT, and the higher the initial interlayer spacing of the OMMT, the easier the intercalation. The intercalated structure in the SiR/I.44P OMMT nanocomposite has the largest interlayer spacing, and the spatial dispersion of OMMT is also the best. When OMMT loading is low (i.e., less than 10 phr), the dispersion of OMMT is poor. The dispersion of OMMT improves with increasing OMMT dosage, when the loading does not exceed 30 phr. The gas barrier property and the mechanical properties of the SiR are obviously improved by the incorporation of OMMT. The nitrogen gas permeability coefficient of the SiR nanocomposite containing 30 phr OMMT (I.44P) is lower than that of net SiR by 31%. To further improve the dispersion of OMMT in SiR, 20 phr fumed silica (FS) was added to the compound before mixing OMMT for increasing viscosity of the compound and mechanical shearing force during compounding OMMT. The resultant SiR/OMMT/FS ternary nanocomposites exhibit improved dispersion of OMMT and better gas barrier property than the binary counterparts. © 2011 Society of Plastics Engineers.
